title: Meade Lux Lewis - 1961 - The Blues Piano Artistry of (1990) FLAC
description:
Meade Lux Lewis - 1961 - The Blues Piano Artistry of (1990)

Boogie-woogie pianist Meade Lux Lewis' next-to-last record was his first recording in five years and his final opportunity to stretch out unaccompanied. This solo Riverside set (reissued by OJC on CD) as usual finds Lewis generally sticking to the blues (with "You Were Meant for Me" and "Fate" being exceptions), mostly performing originals. On a few of the songs Lewis switches effectively to celeste. It apparently only took Meade Lux Lewis two hours to record the full set and the results are quite spontaneous yet well organized, a fine all-around portrait of the veteran pianist in his later period. (AllMusic)

Track list:
01 - Hammer Chatter
02 - You Were Meant for Me
03 - Celeste Bounce
04 - Bear Trap Stomp
05 - Frompy Stomp
06 - Rough Seas
07 - Madame Vod's Celeste Blues
08 - C-Jam Blues
09 - Fate
10 - Breezing at the Celeste

Enjoy and share!
